de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface MaterialDialog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog, android.content.DialogInterface, MaterialDialogDecorator
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimateableDialog, ButtonBarDialog, HeaderDialog, ListDialog, ValidateableDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnimateableDialog, AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractHeaderDialog, AbstractHeaderDialogFragment, AbstractListDialog, AbstractMaterialDialog, AbstractMaterialDialogFragment, AbstractValidateableDialog, EditTextDialog, MaterialDialog, ProgressDialog, WizardDialog

    public interface MaterialDialog
extends MaterialDialogDecorator, android.content.DialogInterface
    Defines the interface, a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • setCancelable

        void setCancelable(boolean cancelable)
        Sets, whether the dialog should be cancelable, or not.
        Specified by:
        setCancelable in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        cancelable - True, if the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, false otherwise

      • setOnShowListener

        void setOnShowListener(@Nullable
                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnShowListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog has been shown.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnShowListener, or null, if no listener should be set

      • setOnCancelListener

        void setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog is canceled. Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see setOnDismissListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        See Also:
        setCancelable(boolean), setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener)

      • setOnDismissListener

        void setOnDismissListener(@Nullable
                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog is dismissed for any reason.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, or null, if no listener should be set

      • getScrollView

        android.widget.ScrollView getScrollView()
        Returns the scroll view, which contains the scrollable areas of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The scroll view, which contains the scrollable areas of the dialog, as an instance of the class ScrollView or null, if the dialog is not shown or if the dialog does not contain any scrollable areas
